column4: Hey People! I try to enable bluetooth on my notebook. Any idea how?
When I do `hcitool scan` it says "Device is not available: No such device"
On the Ubuntu wiki, it says "start bluetooth-applet" but what does this do? nothing happens.
does your bluetooth hardware show up when you enter 'lsusb'?
i dont think so. it shows a bunch of iles like these:
either that, or your integrated bluetooth hardware may be connected to the PCI bus, in which case it will show up in the output of lspci
ubottu: `lspci | grep blue` does not show anything. So I guess this notebook has no bluetooth. I will get an usb-bluetooth-thingy then.
grep is case sensitive. Retry with grep -i
the X20 comes in lots of versions. It's possible that yours doesn't have Bluetooth and you need a dongle.
I bought a nice one the other day, just fingernail-size and round
Bodsda: thank you very much for your help. will switch to another computer now and have to turn off irc.
